intro: Podospermum diversifolium, commonly known as the variable-leaf podospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which range from ovate to lanceolate. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Podospermum diversifolium is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
